The critical issue that makes this phone get such a bad review is this:I used it for less than a week before putting it back in its original box in the closet
It sat there for 9 months and maintained 80% battery charge from 90% when it was stored
I got it out to use it and i can only say how glad I am that it is under warranty
It powered on and worked for about 2 hours then shut itself down
I had turned off all auto updates for the apps installed so it wasnt an update restart
After that the phone was dead
It would not take a charge and it wouldnt turn on
Tech support couldnt get it to work
I tried a hard restart holding volume down button and power at the same time for 10 seconds and that only sent it into a perpetual restart loop
At one point it started vibrating nonstop for a couple minutes then shut down
I was able to do hard restarts a couple times and even got it to start once to try a factory reset
Well long story short, it went through the motions then when it finally booted it had a scrambled pixel screen and no more responses from the screen or buttons except to do a hard power shut down
I'm getting a new one but it will go up for sale to the first offer online even if it cost me a couple hundred

Display design is defective
The LCD Display is Higher resolution than the Stylo 3, but they cut costs by sending a compressed, 4:2:2 signal to the display which cannot be corrected through any setting
The Stylo 3 used its LCD correctly with no color bleeding and no edges blurring
In the Stylo 4 Color fonts on a white background, even black and white text, and the edges of Icons and photographs is ringed and distorted

The entire operating system looks like a badly compressed jpeg with artifacts, and even terminal text is distorted!!With simple dpi test apps that draw lines 1 pixel thick, that line bleeds into the next
They have cut too many corners in the design

This is a Smart Phone in Disguise
We are tech savvy and fully engaged in the online world with various computers
We ordered this phone believing it to be a basic cell phone as described for use as a phone only
However upon charging it up, the first screen that pops up is a lengthy user agreement that one must approve before the phone will be activated
This phone is a KaiOS, made in China and according to their Wikipedia page is fully connected to Google, Facebook and multiple other sites that have nothing to do with cell phone service
In addition, part of the user agreement requires approval for KaiOS and their partners to share your personal information and any data transmitted with unknown third parties
It's a low cost device but if you buy it make sure you're OK with losing any illusion of privacy once you activate it
Suits our needs perfectly

It seems durable enough
As of now most pleased with the purchase

Works great on Page Plus (Verizon MVNO) also

I bought this for an elderly friend who was needing to upgrade due to Verizon's impending CDMA (2G/3G) phase-out, but who made only occasional voice calls, and was emphatic about not wanting a smartphone
It fit the bill nicely, and wasn't too much of a change from her older 3G flip
Switching over was straightforward once we'd gathered all her account details
The phone comes with a suitable SIM already installed
Although locked to Tracfone, like all Tracfone-branded devices this is usable on Page Plus as well because both of those services are now owned and operated by the same company (America Movil)
Page Plus' standard plan can be cheaper for very low-usage lines
This is my friend's service of choice, and we didn't have to even mention the branding of the phone

As it turned out, the Verizon CDMA shutdown was postponed by a year, since there were too many people who wouldn't have made the original deadline, but she now doesn't have to worry about it, and does appreciate the improved voice quality with VoLTE
Battery life is not quite as good, but that seems to be a common issue when moving to LTE from a 3G phone, nothing specific to this Alcatel

Difficult operating system - KaiOS is so close to Chaos
I purchased this phone for my senior parents to replace the older Alcatel phone
The big problem is the Kai OS
The main menu icons, well I'm glad they have text equivalents

Phone does not display remaining days or minutes! I spent quite a while with Tracfone support trying to resolve this and was told the best solution was to periodically call Tracfone to get that information
It's supposedly a phone for seniors, but the operating system settings are challenging to navigate
The font, text style, is 'light' in weight, you can choose a larger font, but this increases the need for both vertical and horizontal scrolling
Lots of the system setting pages have multiple tabs
Simple tasks can be spread out over multiple settings pages
I took some time to go through the settings
I seem to recall that I set the phone to vibrate, but my senior citizen parents complained about the ringtone being too loud and it was

A brutally honest review...
My initial thoughts were, I need a cheap phone that will last me a year while I put off buying an iPhone, and TCL is new to the phone market but hey, their TVs are nice, so I took a shot
Blue finish--came with a little case, too
Attractive looking phone
Turned it on--easy to navigate and setup
I then played with the basics--volume at full blast, camera quality, reaction time, features
For the price, it's very impressive
To start off, Mint Mobile is compatible--instantly worked
Volume is suprisingly loud--louder than my old iPhone
Sounds good too
Camera quality is pretty good too--a lot of features--a little on the slow side, but much better than what you would expect
I'm able to quickly get to things and apps quickly, using the navigator and swiping
Features all the essentials and you can customize your screen
Apps respond nicely
The max brightness is very bright, and after using it for a couple months, I noticed how good the battery life really is

I'm always on the go and tend to drop my phone a lot, and so far it just has a thin crack on the lower half of the screen--purely user error, but I've had similar, if not--WORSE drops with my iPhone 8+ and it totally destroyed the whole screen
After months of taking pictures, downloading music, apps, etc
--phone hasn't slowed at all
I'm able to do everything I could on my iPhone--but this is a guilt free purchase
I really do love this phone
Time will tell, however
But for now, a great product I can't help but recommend
I'm amazed a phone this cheap is this good.
Bought this to replace an old Galaxy S7 I've been using as a back-up phone because it no longer gets updates or support
I wasn't expecting much from a phone <$150 but thought I'd try it
I just got it and installed the updates, downloaded my usual work apps and set everything up
It's been fast and responsive so far
It's got 64 GB of memory and the OS only takes about 11
Only has WiFi 2
4 Ghz but I'm getting a download speed of around 40 mbps
Uses USB-C to charge
Seems to charge a little slow but that isn't an issue for me
No wireless charging, but also not a big deal for a back up device
All the apps I've run have opened quickly and worked perfectly
It's got a headphone jack
It also has a built in radio that uses the headphone wire as an antenna! And you can direct the output either to the headphones or the phone speaker
The external speakers won't win any awards for sound quality while playing music but I don't expect much from a phone speaker anyway
Camera is perfectly serviceable
Volume and on/off button on the right
On the left is a dedicated Google Assistant button
In the box was the phone, charge cable, 2A charger, and a clear softgel phone case
I have a $1000 Samsung phone that didn't come with a charger or a case but I get them with a $140 phone?I activated this phone with US Mobile and they run it off the T Mobile network
No problems at all
I also installed the old 128 GB SD card from my old phone and it works perfectly
If it starts to glitch or have problems I'll update this review
But as a total tech geek I'm seriously impressed so far
I lovvvvvvveeee this phone!!
The phone that I had previously was an Samsung Android S7 yes I know its very old lol

I hope this helps others with problems with the 3G shutdown

A brutally honest review...
My initial thoughts were, I need a cheap phone that will last me a year while I put off buying an iPhone, and TCL is new to the phone market but hey, their TVs are nice, so I took a shot
Blue finish--came with a little case, too
Attractive looking phone
Turned it on--easy to navigate and setup
I then played with the basics--volume at full blast, camera quality, reaction time, features
For the price, it's very impressive
To start off, Mint Mobile is compatible--instantly worked
Volume is suprisingly loud--louder than my old iPhone
Sounds good too
Camera quality is pretty good too--a lot of features--a little on the slow side, but much better than what you would expect
I'm able to quickly get to things and apps quickly, using the navigator and swiping
Features all the essentials and you can customize your screen
Apps respond nicely
The max brightness is very bright, and after using it for a couple months, I noticed how good the battery life really is

I'm always on the go and tend to drop my phone a lot, and so far it just has a thin crack on the lower half of the screen--purely user error, but I've had similar, if not--WORSE drops with my iPhone 8+ and it totally destroyed the whole screen
After months of taking pictures, downloading music, apps, etc
--phone hasn't slowed at all
I'm able to do everything I could on my iPhone--but this is a guilt free purchase
I really do love this phone
Time will tell, however
But for now, a great product I can't help but recommend
I'm amazed a phone this cheap is this good.
Bought this to replace an old Galaxy S7 I've been using as a back-up phone because it no longer gets updates or support
I wasn't expecting much from a phone <$150 but thought I'd try it
I just got it and installed the updates, downloaded my usual work apps and set everything up
It's been fast and responsive so far
It's got 64 GB of memory and the OS only takes about 11
Only has WiFi 2
4 Ghz but I'm getting a download speed of around 40 mbps
Uses USB-C to charge
Seems to charge a little slow but that isn't an issue for me
No wireless charging, but also not a big deal for a back up device
All the apps I've run have opened quickly and worked perfectly
It's got a headphone jack
It also has a built in radio that uses the headphone wire as an antenna! And you can direct the output either to the headphones or the phone speaker
The external speakers won't win any awards for sound quality while playing music but I don't expect much from a phone speaker anyway
Camera is perfectly serviceable
Volume and on/off button on the right
On the left is a dedicated Google Assistant button
In the box was the phone, charge cable, 2A charger, and a clear softgel phone case
I have a $1000 Samsung phone that didn't come with a charger or a case but I get them with a $140 phone?I activated this phone with US Mobile and they run it off the T Mobile network
No problems at all
I also installed the old 128 GB SD card from my old phone and it works perfectly
If it starts to glitch or have problems I'll update this review
But as a total tech geek I'm seriously impressed so far
I lovvvvvvveeee this phone!!

A brutally honest review...
My initial thoughts were, I need a cheap phone that will last me a year while I put off buying an iPhone, and TCL is new to the phone market but hey, their TVs are nice, so I took a shot
Blue finish--came with a little case, too
Attractive looking phone
Turned it on--easy to navigate and setup
I then played with the basics--volume at full blast, camera quality, reaction time, features
For the price, it's very impressive
To start off, Mint Mobile is compatible--instantly worked
Volume is suprisingly loud--louder than my old iPhone
Sounds good too
Camera quality is pretty good too--a lot of features--a little on the slow side, but much better than what you would expect
I'm able to quickly get to things and apps quickly, using the navigator and swiping
Features all the essentials and you can customize your screen
Apps respond nicely
The max brightness is very bright, and after using it for a couple months, I noticed how good the battery life really is

I'm always on the go and tend to drop my phone a lot, and so far it just has a thin crack on the lower half of the screen--purely user error, but I've had similar, if not--WORSE drops with my iPhone 8+ and it totally destroyed the whole screen
After months of taking pictures, downloading music, apps, etc
--phone hasn't slowed at all
I'm able to do everything I could on my iPhone--but this is a guilt free purchase
I really do love this phone
Time will tell, however
But for now, a great product I can't help but recommend
I'm amazed a phone this cheap is this good.
Bought this to replace an old Galaxy S7 I've been using as a back-up phone because it no longer gets updates or support
I wasn't expecting much from a phone <$150 but thought I'd try it
I just got it and installed the updates, downloaded my usual work apps and set everything up
It's been fast and responsive so far
It's got 64 GB of memory and the OS only takes about 11
Only has WiFi 2
4 Ghz but I'm getting a download speed of around 40 mbps
Uses USB-C to charge
Seems to charge a little slow but that isn't an issue for me
No wireless charging, but also not a big deal for a back up device
All the apps I've run have opened quickly and worked perfectly
It's got a headphone jack
It also has a built in radio that uses the headphone wire as an antenna! And you can direct the output either to the headphones or the phone speaker
The external speakers won't win any awards for sound quality while playing music but I don't expect much from a phone speaker anyway
Camera is perfectly serviceable
Volume and on/off button on the right
On the left is a dedicated Google Assistant button
In the box was the phone, charge cable, 2A charger, and a clear softgel phone case
I have a $1000 Samsung phone that didn't come with a charger or a case but I get them with a $140 phone?I activated this phone with US Mobile and they run it off the T Mobile network
No problems at all
I also installed the old 128 GB SD card from my old phone and it works perfectly
If it starts to glitch or have problems I'll update this review
But as a total tech geek I'm seriously impressed so far

A brutally honest review...
My initial thoughts were, I need a cheap phone that will last me a year while I put off buying an iPhone, and TCL is new to the phone market but hey, their TVs are nice, so I took a shot
Blue finish--came with a little case, too
Attractive looking phone
Turned it on--easy to navigate and setup
I then played with the basics--volume at full blast, camera quality, reaction time, features
For the price, it's very impressive
To start off, Mint Mobile is compatible--instantly worked
Volume is suprisingly loud--louder than my old iPhone
Sounds good too
Camera quality is pretty good too--a lot of features--a little on the slow side, but much better than what you would expect
I'm able to quickly get to things and apps quickly, using the navigator and swiping
Features all the essentials and you can customize your screen
Apps respond nicely
The max brightness is very bright, and after using it for a couple months, I noticed how good the battery life really is

I'm always on the go and tend to drop my phone a lot, and so far it just has a thin crack on the lower half of the screen--purely user error, but I've had similar, if not--WORSE drops with my iPhone 8+ and it totally destroyed the whole screen
After months of taking pictures, downloading music, apps, etc
--phone hasn't slowed at all
I'm able to do everything I could on my iPhone--but this is a guilt free purchase
I really do love this phone
Time will tell, however
But for now, a great product I can't help but recommend
I'm amazed a phone this cheap is this good.
Bought this to replace an old Galaxy S7 I've been using as a back-up phone because it no longer gets updates or support
I wasn't expecting much from a phone <$150 but thought I'd try it
I just got it and installed the updates, downloaded my usual work apps and set everything up
It's been fast and responsive so far
It's got 64 GB of memory and the OS only takes about 11
Only has WiFi 2
4 Ghz but I'm getting a download speed of around 40 mbps
Uses USB-C to charge
Seems to charge a little slow but that isn't an issue for me
No wireless charging, but also not a big deal for a back up device
All the apps I've run have opened quickly and worked perfectly
It's got a headphone jack
It also has a built in radio that uses the headphone wire as an antenna! And you can direct the output either to the headphones or the phone speaker
The external speakers won't win any awards for sound quality while playing music but I don't expect much from a phone speaker anyway
Camera is perfectly serviceable
Volume and on/off button on the right
On the left is a dedicated Google Assistant button
In the box was the phone, charge cable, 2A charger, and a clear softgel phone case
I have a $1000 Samsung phone that didn't come with a charger or a case but I get them with a $140 phone?I activated this phone with US Mobile and they run it off the T Mobile network
No problems at all
I also installed the old 128 GB SD card from my old phone and it works perfectly
If it starts to glitch or have problems I'll update this review
But as a total tech geek I'm seriously impressed so far
I lovvvvvvveeee this phone!!
The phone that I had previously was an Samsung Android S7 yes I know its very old lol
